bibl.title: Despatch from William H. Heard to Edwin F. Uhl, December 3, 1895
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: Consulate-General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, Dec 3rd, 1895.

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D. JAN 10 1896 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: William H. Heard, to the Department of State.
Consulate-General of the United States Monrovia, Liberia, Dec 3rd 1895
Hon.Edwin F, Uhl, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington D. C.
Sir: I have investigated charges against Mr. B. Y. Payne for drunkeness and find them unfounded. therefore most respectfully ask his reappointment as vice consul. His bond has been newly approved--
I am obediently William H. Heard Min. Res. and Con. Gen.
